questions.question: Which of the following would increase the maximum safe speed on a flat curve?
options: Increasing the mass of the car.
Decreasing the radius of the curve.
Increasing the coefficient of static friction.

questions.question: A car rounds a flat curve with a radius of $40 \text{ m}$. If $\mu_s = 0.4$, what is the maximum speed the car can travel without skidding? (Use $g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2$)
A curve of radius $90 \text{ m}$ is banked at such an angle that the ideal speed is $30 \text{ m/s}$. What is the value of $\tan\theta$ for this bank? (Use $g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2$)
A $1200 \text{ kg}$ car and a $2400 \text{ kg}$ truck take the same flat curve ($r = 50 \text{ m}$, $\mu_s = 0.5$). If the car's max speed is $15.8 \text{ m/s}$, the truck's max speed is:
questions.explanation: $v_{max} = \sqrt{\mu_s r g}$ is independent of mass, so truck's max speed is also $15.8$ m/s.

questions.question: A coin is $0.1 \text{ m}$ from the center of a turntable. If $\mu_s = 0.4$, what is the maximum angular speed ($\omega$) in rad/s before it slips? (Use $g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2$)
A highway curve with radius $100 \text{ m}$ is banked at $15^\circ$. What is the ideal (no friction) speed for this curve? (Use $g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2$ and $\tan 15^\circ \approx 0.27$)
If a car needs a centripetal force of $5000 \text{ N}$ to make a turn, and the maximum static friction available is $4500 \text{ N}$, what happens?
options: The car makes the turn safely.
questions.explanation: Required force > available force, so car cannot maintain circular path and skids outward.

questions.question: A $0.5 \text{ kg}$ mass is attached to a $0.8 \text{ m}$ string on a frictionless table and rotates at $5 \text{ rad/s}$. What is the tension?
To double the maximum speed on a flat curve without changing the tires, the radius of the curve must be:
A car travels at $20 \text{ m/s}$ on a flat curve of radius $80 \text{ m}$. What is the minimum $\mu_s$ required? (Use $g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2$)

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You've mastered circular motion problem solving.
scoreMessages.70: Good work! Review the formulas for flat curves and banked curves.
scoreMessages.50: Keep practicing. Focus on $v_{max} = \sqrt{\mu_s r g}$ and $\tan\theta = v^2/(rg)$.
